comments:
Hi-All

*WARNING : New Poster (so apologies for any mistakes / mis-understandings)

Have just installed VE-1.1 into a new Eclipse-3.1 installation (configuration
detailed below in <Configuration></Configuration> tags) and whenever I try to
open a new visual class and/or edit an existing visual class I receievd the
"Setup Java Visual Editor" internal error (see <Log></Log> tags).

A quick Google gave me
dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.tools.ve/msg04495.html, but it didn't
really help.

Any suggestions ??

Thanks-in-advance.
Stuart Hudson


<Log>
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-09-12 09:47:17.38
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Setup Java Visual Editor".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
org/eclipse/emf/ecore/util/EcoreEList$UnmodifiableEList$FastCompare
	at

	at

	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil.getRegisteredAdapter(EcoreUtil.java:100)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.java.impl.JavaClassImpl.getIntrospectionAdapter(JavaClassImpl.java:476)
	at org.eclipse.jem.java.impl.JavaClassImpl.getEAnnotations(JavaClassImpl.java:385)
	at

	at

	at

	at

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)
</Log>

How did you install this? Did you use the official final released versions of
EMF 2.1 and GEF 3.1 and VE 1.1.0.1?

This error indicates there is an installation error. This class should not be
not found if the correct EMF and VE are installed.

Three things:

1) You don't need both JEM-SDK and VE-SDK. VE-SDK includes JEM-SDK already.
2) You don't need an update site. The Eclipse Update site already has VE 1.1.0
on it, so once you install that you can do a scan for updates and it will find
the VE 1.1.0.1 update.
3) Are you trying to open a class in a web project? If you are, this is a
current WTP bug. It conflicts with VE in a web project

Rich

Have completely re-installed, but skipped the installation of JEM (as per your
last reply) and the problem that I had encountered no longer appears.

Thanks for all your help.

Stuart

We like to close configuration problems with WORKSFORME instead of FIXED. It
helps for tracking purposes. Thanks.
